job_description: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst & Administrator, Temp - job post Pattern Energy Group LP 21 reviews San Francisco, CA 94111 • Hybrid remote $38 - $51 an hour -  Full-time, Temporary You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $38 - $51 an hour Job Type Full-time Temporary Overview: Company Overview Pattern Energy is a leading renewable energy company that develops, constructs, owns, and operates high-quality wind and solar generation, transmission, and energy storage facilities. Our mission is to transition the world to renewable energy through the sustainable development and responsible operation of facilities with respect for the environment, communities, and cultures where we have a presence. Our approach begins and ends with establishing trust, accountability, and transparency. Our company values of creative spirit, pride of ownership, follow-through, and a team-first attitude drive us to pursue our mission every day. Our culture supports our values by fostering innovative and critical thinking and a deep belief in living up to our promises. Headquartered in the United States, Pattern has a global portfolio of more than 35 power facilities and transmission assets, serving various customers that provide low-cost clean energy to millions of consumers. Responsibilities: Job Purpose This role serves as Senior business analyst and admin for Salesforce CRM implementation and post implementation phases. Initially, the role will have strong accountability related to the original implementation of a new Salesforce enterprise instance, ensuring end user customer-facing requirements are thoroughly captured, documented, designed, tested, and deployed. This will involve working closely with the Senior Manager, implementation partner consultants, business owner stakeholders, and internal and external technical teams to build out and maintain the system to required specifications. This is a business-facing role that requires an organized individual to capture, document and develop strategies for the needs of the business via workshop facilitation and roadmap development for future state. This role is the crucial link between system end users and a system that is new to the organization. The ability to think strategically, connect the dots, as well as be comfortable in the details of the deliverables, juggling many competing deliverables, is essential. To maximize these objectives, the role requires strong understanding of systems and a close partnership with departments such as Origination, Development, External Affairs, Finance, Operations, and other parts of the business to ensure optimal deployment and adoption of the system. Skills and abilities relevant to the job include: Ability to work with an extended global team approach and innovation. Ability to successfully operate in different cultures. Cross-business and cross-functional collaboration and team skills, including a willingness to contribute thought leadership and execute on others' ideas. Ability to energize self and others toward passionate and superb execution. Ability to travel up to 20 percent of the time. Established proficiency in Salesforce, including: Customization (mainly via configuration with a few exceptions) of fields, forms, dashboards, reports, third party tool integrations, etc. Established proficiency in a variety of business applications beyond CRM, including: MS Office Applications (PowerPoint, Excel, Word) Proficiency in Excel formulas preferred. Visio, Lucidchart, or other process mapping software Azure DevOps ServiceNow Ability to work with an extended global team approach and innovation. Ability to successfully operate in different cultures. Cross-business and cross-functional collaboration and team skills, including a willingness to contribute thought leadership and execute on others' ideas. Ability to energize self and others toward passionate and superb execution. Ability to travel up to 20 percent of the time. Key Accountabilities Functional Support: Responsible to: Partner with target stakeholders to gather requirements and help them determine solutions to meet the business needs or resolve business problems. Lead and document the Process Flow design using Visio or Lucidchart. Track requirements in Azure ADO through user stories. Day-to-day System Maintenance: Responsible for day-to day maintenance, execution of approved configurations, user support, and improvement of our evolving CRM platform. Provide day-to-day technical support and problem resolution, including managing user errors, bug request queue, troubleshooting and escalating issues when needed. Serve as the expert to define, design, and configure error features and enhancements to Salesforce platform by bridging the gap between the current implemented Salesforce functionalities and Pattern’s evolving business processes. Own and manage assigned support tickets and responsible for the backlog delivery. System Enhancement: Lead Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Object, field, and record management, workflow, process builder, flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, third party tools/apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration, dashboards, and reports. Work with stakeholders to identify, gather and translate business and technical requirements into scalable business solutions for a diverse range of stakeholders with a focus on change management and user experience. - good understanding of the impact of changes in the system and business processes is required. Work with Senior Product manager to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes. Training & Output Support: User support is important to our team; therefore, the Salesforce Business Analyst & Admin should enjoy all aspects of user management including new user training, feedback gathering, troubleshoot and debug application systems on priority and timely manner, etc. Develop intermediate complex reports and dashboards within Salesforce CRM for a variety of audiences in the system. Assist with new users and ongoing user training sessions. Monitor and improve user adoption. Qualifications: Experience/Qualifications/Education Required Additional Requirements 5+ years’ experience as a Salesforce Administrator with end-to-end implementation experience and expert level understanding of the Lightning Platform of Salesforce Sales and Service Cloud, Force.com and overall architecture. 5+ years of experience in SDLC project management and analysis including facilitating requirements gathering, documenting use cases, process flows/swim lane diagrams, user acceptance testing, change management, etc. Advanced knowledge and understanding of system configurations, customizations, and the ability to audit, recommend, improve, and/or update customizations to fit the needs of each internal stakeholder. A bachelor's degree in computer science would be advantageous. Technical Skills Salesforce Administrator Certification is required. Candidates with Advanced Admin Certification or/and System Architect would be advantageous. Solid understanding of Agile / Scrum delivery models. Salesforce integration and DevOps experience. Experience in automated release management tools preferred. Advanced understanding of how Salesforce interacts with other platforms, such as D365 Finance and Operations (D365FO) ERP, SharePoint, Smartsheet, ServiceNow, Hubspot, ActiveCampaign, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, LinkedIn, etc. The expected starting hourly pay range for this role is $38.00 - $51.00/Hour USD. This range is an estimate and base pay may be above or below the ranges based on several factors including but not limited to location, work experience, certifications, and education. Pattern Energy Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. #LI-AT1 #LI-Hybrid
